name: Indian Keyboard
author: Binod Narayan Sethi

sections.description: This plugin let you type in Amharic, Arabic, Bengali, Chinese, Greek, Gujrati, Hindi, Canada, Malayalam, Marathi, Nepali, Odia, Persian, Punjabi, Russian, Sanskrit, Serbian, Sinhalese, Tamil, Telugu, Tigrinya and Urdu in backend post, pages and catagories just using a popup window that run with google API which can be copied and pasted anywhere you want.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/Indian-Keyboard directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use the Settings->Plugin Name screen to configure the plugin
sections.faq:
What does this plugin do?

This plugin empowers you to write in your native language with only phonetic english.

How can I write?

There will be keyboard icon on your editor. Just click it and there will be a popup window with help how to use phonetic english to write in your own native language.Just use phonetic english and it will convert it to your unicode native language. Copy and paste it in your required places wherever you want. In this process easily one can make a website in their own native language.

Is it platform independent?

Yes its platform independent and fonts can be seen in any unicode installed OS.

short_description: Let you type in your native language using phonetic english.
